b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (09:02): the "broadcaster's point of view" of HTML5 is interesting
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (09:02): treating the video element as TV instead of considering the other stuff around it
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (09:03): what if the user doesn't have a <video> playing during a tsunami?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (09:04): shouldn't the tsunami warning system be a separate daemon that's always in the background?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (09:09): like Twitter?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (09:14): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: I was thinking of something running on the OS level and permission to stick stuff on the screen and to play audio
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (09:16): "The following references link to Editor's Drafts, not Working Drafts" :-(
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (09:19): HbbTV-- for using a new doctype (and new MIME type) and wanting HTML entities to work
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (09:21): maybe i should instead of trying to fight against it suggest that the HbbTV doctype be added to html5
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (09:26): although other browsers don't support the mime type anyway

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:42): silly side-effect of the component change is that it de-prioritised everything in the LC components since they've not changed more recently than anything in any other component -_-
afb0216dbb5a9709eab37eaa5a4422eb (09:44): Hey, gang
afb0216dbb5a9709eab37eaa5a4422eb (09:44): question about svg

afb0216dbb5a9709eab37eaa5a4422eb (09:45): hixie: want to take a stab at this? What's the different in and value of embedding svg using <img>, <embed>, <object> or <iframe>? I noticed that the <img> tag doesn't display consistenly across browsers (Chrome sorta barfs on it). Is there a time when one would use one or the other?
afb0216dbb5a9709eab37eaa5a4422eb (09:46): s/different in/difference in/
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:46): per spec, the only reason you'd not use img is if you want the graphic to be interactive
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:46): then you'd use object.
afb0216dbb5a9709eab37eaa5a4422eb (09:47): Okay, that's pretty much what I wrote. Chrome's handling of the <img> tag for svg is fugly, though!

afb0216dbb5a9709eab37eaa5a4422eb (09:48): If you're curious, have a look at http://html5 afb0216dbb5a9709eab37eaa5a4422eb.com/chp_5.html, and look at the "A Circle, using the <img> tag to embed it" under SVG
afb0216dbb5a9709eab37eaa5a4422eb (09:48): FF does it right, Chrome does not.
afb0216dbb5a9709eab37eaa5a4422eb (09:49): Unless I'm doing it wrong?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:49): browsers have bugs, news at 11 :-)
afb0216dbb5a9709eab37eaa5a4422eb (09:49): Heh. No doubt.
afb0216dbb5a9709eab37eaa5a4422eb (09:49): Dummies wanna know!
afb0216dbb5a9709eab37eaa5a4422eb (09:49): :D
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (09:49): afb0216dbb5a9709eab37eaa5a4422eb: img has different security characteristics and doesn't create a browsing context
afb0216dbb5a9709eab37eaa5a4422eb (09:49): splain, please?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (09:49): afb0216dbb5a9709eab37eaa5a4422eb: object and iframe have the disadvantage of creating a browsing context
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (09:50): afb0216dbb5a9709eab37eaa5a4422eb: inlining doesn't create a browsing context
afb0216dbb5a9709eab37eaa5a4422eb (09:50): ah
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (09:50): afb0216dbb5a9709eab37eaa5a4422eb: I can't remember what <embed> does

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (09:50): afb0216dbb5a9709eab37eaa5a4422eb: the main annoyance of a browsing context is that non-targeted links cause navigation within the browsing context instead of navigating the parent
afb0216dbb5a9709eab37eaa5a4422eb (09:50): yes
afb0216dbb5a9709eab37eaa5a4422eb (09:51): So for Dummies, maybe I shouldn't mention them as options?
afb0216dbb5a9709eab37eaa5a4422eb (09:51): Or with heavy disclaimers...
afb0216dbb5a9709eab37eaa5a4422eb (09:52): Have I mentioned lately that you guys rock?
afb0216dbb5a9709eab37eaa5a4422eb (09:52): Thanks
afb0216dbb5a9709eab37eaa5a4422eb (09:55): Okay, on that happy note, g'nite, all
afb0216dbb5a9709eab37eaa5a4422eb (09:55): Thanks
